title: A Random Walk Down Wall Street
author: Burton G. Malkiel
description: A classic guide to investing, explaining the basics of stocks, bonds, and index funds, and advocating for a long-term, passive investment strategy.

title: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: David Thomas, Andrew Hunt
description: A foundational book for software developers, offering practical advice and best practices for writing flexible, maintainable code.

title: Crack-Up Capitalism
author: Quinn Slobodian
description: Explores how market radicals have sought to create zones of capitalism free from democratic oversight, and the implications for global politics.

title: Stuck
author: Yoni Appelbaum
description: Examines how America’s elite have shaped the country’s economic and social systems, leading to stagnation and reduced opportunity.

title: Code Dependent: Living in the Shadow of AI
author: Madhumita Murgia
description: Investigates the impact of artificial intelligence on society, work, and personal lives, highlighting both opportunities and risks.

title: The Anxious Investor
author: Scott Nations
description: Explores the psychology of investing, why investors make mistakes, and how to avoid common pitfalls.

title: Javascript Scratch Crash Course
author: Nick Morgan
description: A hands-on, project-based introduction to programming using Scratch, ideal for beginners and young learners.

title: Land Between the Rivers: A 5,000-Year History of Iraq
author: Bartle Bull
description: Panoptic, fearless, and beautifully written, this book covers the epic, five-millennia history of the region between the Tigris and Euphrates Rivers, the birthplace of civilization and a crucial crossroads between East and West. It explores Iraq’s rich and turbulent past, from its earliest civilizations to modern times.

title: Designing Your Life
author: Bill Burnett & Dave Evans
description: Applies design thinking principles to building a meaningful, fulfilling life and career.

title: Empty Vessel
author: Ian Kumekawa
description: The story of the global economy as seen through the journey of a single barge.

title: An Abundance of Caution
author: David Zweig
description: Examines the impact of decisions made by American schools during the virus outbreak.

title: Positive Intelligence
author: Shirzad Chamine
description: Explores why only 20% of teams and individuals achieve their potential and how to improve mental fitness.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones through small, incremental changes.

title: Paradise Lost
author: John Milton
description: An epic poem exploring the fall of man and the battle between good and evil.

title: Jonathan Livingston Seagull
author: Richard Bach
description: Ispiration for an Italian who lived alone on an island for 32 years. A fable about a seagull's journey of self-discovery and freedom.

title: Mike Mulligan and His Steam Shovel
author: Virginia Lee Burton
description: A classic children's story about a steam shovel and its operator's dedication.

title: On the Edge
author: Nate Silver
description: Explores the art and science of risk-taking in various domains.

title: Building Material
author: Stephen Bruno
description: A memoir of life as a Park Avenue doorman.

title: The Message
author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
description: A personal exploration of history, culture, and identity.

title: The Creature From Jekyll Island
author: G. Edward Griffin
description: An investigation into the history and impact of the Federal Reserve.

title: Kingmaker
author: Sonia Purnell
description: A biography of Pamela Harriman's life of power and influence.

title: Hope for Cynics
author: Jamil Zaki
description: Explores the science of human goodness to counter cynicism.

title: The Book of Charlie
author: David Von Drehle
description: The life story and wisdom of a 109-year-old American man.

title: Follow the Science
author: Sharyl Attkisson
description: Critiques the influence of Big Pharma on science and public health.

title: 10 to 25
author: David S. Yeager
description: A guide to motivating young people using groundbreaking approaches.

title: Revenge of the Tipping Point
author: Malcolm Gladwell
description: Explores social engineering, superspreaders, and cultural tipping points.

title: Key to the City
author: Sara C. Bronin
description: Examines how zoning laws shape urban development and society.

title: The Extinction of Experience
author: Christine Rosen
description: Discusses the impact of digital culture on human experience.

title: Writing your Legacy
author: Richard Campbell
description: A step-by-step guide to crafting your personal life story.

title: The Denial of Death
author: Ernest Becker
description: Explores the human fear of mortality and its impact on behavior.

title: Digital Dharma
author: Deepak Chopra
description: Explores how AI can enhance spiritual intelligence and well-being.

title: Never Enough
author: Andrew Wilkinson
description: A memoir of a journey from barista to billionaire.

title: You Only Die Once
author: Jodi Wellman
description: A guide to living without regrets by embracing mortality.

title: Just Keep Buying
author: Nick Maggiulli
description: Practical strategies for saving money and building wealth.

title: When Breath Becomes Air
author: Paul Kalanithi
description: A memoir about life, death, and meaning from a neurosurgeon facing terminal illness.

title: Nexus
author: Yuval N. Harari
description: A history of information networks from the Stone Age to the AI era.

title: Range
author: David J. Epstein
description: Argues that generalists, not specialists, thrive in a complex world.

title: Billionaire, Nerd, Savior, King
author: Anupreeta Das
description: A biography of Bill Gates and his influence on technology and society.

title: Frostbite
author: Nicola Twilley
description: Examines how refrigeration transformed food, society, and the environment.

title: The Algebra of Wealth
author: Scott Galloway
description: A straightforward guide to achieving financial security.

title: The New Tourist
author: Paige McClanahan
description: Explores the power and challenges of modern tourism.

title: Over Ruled
author: Neil M. Gorsuch
description: Examines the human cost of excessive legal regulation.

title: Stolen Focus
author: Johann Hari
description: Investigates why attention is diminishing and how to reclaim deep thinking.

title: All the Beauty in the World
author: Patrick Bringley
description: A memoir of working as a guard at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Tomorrow, and Tomorrow, and Tomorrow
author: Gabrielle Zevin
description: A novel about friendship, creativity, and the gaming industry.

title: Up in Arms
author: Adam E. Casey
description: Analyzes how military aid impacts foreign autocrats.

title: Sailing Alone
author: Richard J. King
description: A history of isolation and survival at sea.

title: In This Economy?
author: Kyla Scanlon
description: Explains how money and markets function in the modern economy.

title: The King of Diamonds
author: Rena Pederson
description: The search for an elusive Texas jewel thief.

title: Taber's Cyclopedic Medical Dictionary
description: A comprehensive medical dictionary for health professionals and students.

title: Good Energy
author: Casey Means
description: Explores the connection between metabolism and overall health.

title: The Chinese Groove
author: Kathryn Ma
description: A novel about family, identity, and finding one's place in the world.

title: Co-intelligence
author: Ethan Mollick
description: A guide to living and working with artificial intelligence.

title: The Year of Living Constitutionally
author: A. J. Jacobs
description: A humorous exploration of living by the Constitution's original meaning.

title: The Herbal Year
author: Christina Hart-Davies
description: Explores folklore, history, and remedies of herbal plants.

title: The Israel Lobby and U.S. Foreign Policy
author: John J. Mearsheimer
description: Examines the influence of the Israel lobby on U.S. foreign policy.

title: Balance of Power
author: Eric MonnetNicholas Mulder
description: Analyzes the role of central banks in shaping democracies.

title: Operation Mincemeat
author: Ben Macintyre
description: The story of a WWII deception that fooled the Nazis.

title: A Man Called Intrepid
author: William Stevenson
description: The story of WWII espionage and intelligence operations.

title: The Cholesterol Hoax
author: Sherry A. Rogers
description: Challenges conventional views on cholesterol and health.

title: Bad Therapy
author: Abigail Shrier
description: Critiques modern therapeutic practices and their impact on children.

title: Number Go Up
author: Zeke Faux
description: Chronicles the rise and fall of the cryptocurrency boom.

title: Slow Productivity
author: Cal Newport
description: Advocates for a slower, more intentional approach to productivity.

title: Why We Remember
author: Charan Ranganath
description: Explores the science of memory and its role in our lives.

title: Limitarianism
author: Ingrid Robeyns
description: Argues against extreme wealth and its societal impacts.

title: The Heart and the Chip
author: Daniela Rus
description: Explores the future of robotics and human-machine collaboration.

title: Filterworld
author: Kyle Chayka
description: Examines how algorithms shape culture and personal taste.

title: Vagabonds
author: Oskar Cox Jensen
description: A history of life on the streets of 19th-century London.

title: Joan Didion
author: Joan Didion
description: A collection of Joan Didion's works from the 1960s and 70s.

title: Starborn
author: Roberto Trotta
description: Explores how stars have shaped human history and identity.

title: The Expectation Effect
author: David Robson
description: Explains how mindset influences outcomes in health, work, and life.

title: Rethinking Diabetes
author: Gary Taubes
description: Examines scientific approaches to diet, insulin, and diabetes treatment.

title: The Last Ships From Hamburg
author: Steven Ujifusa
description: The story of saving Russia's Jews before World War I.

title: The Best Land Under Heaven
author: Michael Wallis
description: The story of the Donner Party and the American West.

title: Our Beloved Kin
author: Lisa Tanya Brooks
description: A new history of King Philip's War and its impact.

title: How to Ikigai
author: Tim Tamashiro
description: A guide to finding happiness and purpose using the Japanese concept of Ikigai.

title: Every Man for Himself and God Against All
author: Werner Herzog
description: A memoir by filmmaker Werner Herzog reflecting on his life and work.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer, translated by Emily Wilson
description: A modern translation of the classic epic poem about Odysseus's journey.

title: Agave Spirits
author: Gary Paul Nabhan
description: Explores the history and future of mezcal and agave-based spirits.

title: Who Discovered America?
author: Gavin Menzies
description: Investigates the untold history of the peopling of the Americas.

title: The Prize
author: Daniel Yergin
description: A comprehensive history of the oil industry and its global impact.

title: End of Discussion
author: Mary Katharine Ham
description: Critiques the culture of outrage and its impact on free speech.

title: At Home
author: Bill Bryson
description: A history of private life through the lens of the home.

title: Capitalism
author: Jürgen Kocka
description: A concise history of capitalism and its evolution.

title: The Economic Weapon
author: Nicholas Mulder
description: Explores the rise of sanctions as a tool of modern warfare.

title: The Rise and Fall of American Growth
author: Robert J. Gordon
description: Analyzes the history of U.S. economic growth and living standards.

title: Carmageddon
author: Daniel Knowles
description: Examines the negative impacts of car-centric urban planning.

title: Outlive
author: Peter Attia
description: A guide to longevity through science and lifestyle changes.

title: Allergic
author: Theresa MacPhail
description: Explores the rise of allergies in the modern world.

title: The Worldly Philosophers
author: Robert L. Heilbroner
description: A history of economic thought through the lives of great thinkers.

title: Pharma
author: Gerald L. Posner
description: Investigates greed and deception in the pharmaceutical industry.

title: Trust
author: Hernán Díaz
description: A novel exploring wealth, power, and truth in America.

title: Not Accountable
author: Philip K. Howard
description: Critiques the constitutionality of public employee unions.

title: Paddle-to-the-Sea
author: Holling Clancy Holling
description: A children's story about a carved canoe's journey through the Great Lakes.

title: Young Forever
author: Mark Hyman
description: A guide to living a longer, healthier life through science-backed strategies.

title: The Whereabouts of Eneas McNulty
author: Sebastian Barry
description: A novel about an Irishman's life and struggles in the early 20th century.

title: Julia Morgan
author: Mark A. Wilson
description: A biography of architect Julia Morgan and her iconic designs.

title: The Wager
author: David Grann
description: A true story of shipwreck, mutiny, and murder in the 18th century.

title: The Big Con
author: Mariana Mazzucato
description: Critiques the consulting industry's impact on businesses and governments.

title: Heart, You Bully, You Punk
author: Leah Hager Cohen
description: A novel exploring love, loss, and personal growth.

title: The Norton Anthology of American Literature
description: A collection of significant works in American literature.

title: Pastoral Song
author: James Rebanks
description: A farmer's journey reflecting on agriculture and the environment.
